definitions.definition: something, such as a large building, that you can see clearly from a distance and that will help you to know where you are

examples.text: The Empire State Building is a familiar landmark on the New York skyline.
The tower was once a landmark for ships.

definitions.definition: an event, a discovery, an invention, etc. that marks an important stage in something

examples.text: The ceasefire was seen as a major landmark in the fight against terrorism.
The trial was seen as a landmark case.
The magazine's 150th anniversary was an important publishing landmark.
It disputes many of the findings of Gill's landmark study.
a landmark decision on the limits of presidential power
a landmark decision on gay marriage
The film is an important landmark in the history of the cinema.
The Russian Revolution represents a landmark in world history.

definitions.definition: a building or a place that is very important because of its history, and that should be preserved

examples.text: The residents are seeking landmark status for the building.
The building has been designated a historical landmark by the Commission.
